intro: Eritrichium closii, commonly known as the Sierra bluecup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its small, cup-shaped blooms appear in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eritrichium closii is known for its resilience to harsh mountain conditions and is often found in open meadows and along stream banks.
